titles.title: To amend title 11, District of Columbia Code, to remove gender-specific references.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on District of Columbia.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E887)

committee.name: House Committee on District of Columbia

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on District of Columbia

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on District of Columbia. H. Rept. 103-175.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 66.

action.text: Mr. Stark moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

committee.name: House Committee on District of Columbia

calendar.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Glenn without amendment. With written report No. 103-262.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 430.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 7/19/1993--Passed House amended. Amends title 11 of the District of Columbia Code and the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act to remove gender-specific references relating to organization and jurisdiction of the District of Columbia courts and in the District Charter relating to the judiciary.
